commit_message:
let hacking install its dependencies

hacking pulls in the right versions of flake8, mccabe, pep8 and
pyflakes already, listing them explicitely is unnecessary and
can cause mismatches.

Change-Id: Id44c90ddd4a8a2204fd7ce600097bafbc9469993

commit_message:
Test: rescue_interface to base driver class

This commit adds `rescue` interface to `BaseDriver` and implements
it for `fake-hardware` hardware type. It adds configuration
parameters '[DEFAULT]/enabled_rescue_interfaces' and
'[DEFAULT]/default_rescue_interface'. The default value of
configuration parameter '[DEFAULT]/enabled_rescue_interfaces' is
`no-rescue`.

It adds new rescue states and a new 'rescue' field to the Node
object. It adds objects.node.Node._convert_to_version().
The method handles converting the new rescue_interface field
between different versions of the Node.

It also adds a data migration script to fill node.rescue_interface
for hardware type managed nodes to 'no-rescue'.

Change-Id: I8c9bb5c6484fb064c16571a3bce22d674cbd6ba2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/71/527371/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestConvertToVersion(db_base.DbTestCase, obj_utils.SchemasTestMixIn): def setUp(self): super(TestConvertToVersion, self).setUp() self.ctxt = context.get_admin_context() def test_rescue_supported_missing(self): # rescue_interface not set, should be set to default. self.fake_node = db_utils.get_test_node(driver='fake-hardware') self.node = obj_utils.get_test_node(self.ctxt, **self.fake_node) node = objects.Node(self.context, **self.fake_node) delattr(node, 'rescue_interface') node.obj_reset_changes() node._convert_to_version("1.22") self.assertIsNone(node.rescue_interface) self.assertEqual({'rescue_interface': None}, node.obj_get_changes()) def test_rescue_supported_set(self): # rescue_interface set, no change required. self.fake_node = db_utils.get_test_node(driver='fake-hardware') self.node = obj_utils.get_test_node(self.ctxt, **self.fake_node) node = objects.Node(self.context, **self.fake_node) node.rescue_interface = 'fake' node.obj_reset_changes() node._convert_to_version("1.22") self.assertEqual('fake', node.rescue_interface) self.assertEqual({}, node.obj_get_changes()) def test_rescue_unsupported_missing(self): # rescue_interface not set, no change required. self.fake_node = db_utils.get_test_node(driver='fake-hardware') self.node = obj_utils.get_test_node(self.ctxt, **self.fake_node) node = objects.Node(self.context, **self.fake_node) delattr(node, 'rescue_interface') node.obj_reset_changes() node._convert_to_version("1.21") self.assertNotIn('rescue_interface', node) self.assertEqual({}, node.obj_get_changes()) def test_rescue_unsupported_set_remove(self): # rescue_interface set, should be removed. self.fake_node = db_utils.get_test_node(driver='fake-hardware') self.node = obj_utils.get_test_node(self.ctxt, **self.fake_node) node = objects.Node(self.context, **self.fake_node) node.rescue_interface = 'myrescue' node.obj_reset_changes() node._convert_to_version("1.21") self.assertNotIn('myrescue', node) self.assertEqual({}, node.obj_get_changes()) def test_rescue_unsupported_set_no_remove_non_default(self): # rescue_interface set, should be set to default. self.fake_node = db_utils.get_test_node(driver='fake-hardware') self.node = obj_utils.get_test_node(self.ctxt, **self.fake_node) node = objects.Node(self.context, **self.fake_node) node.rescue_interface = 'myrescue' node.obj_reset_changes() node._convert_to_version("1.21", False) self.assertIsNone(node.rescue_interface) self.assertEqual({'rescue_interface': None}, node.obj_get_changes()) def test_rescue_unsupported_set_no_remove_default(self): # rescue_interface set, no change required. self.fake_node = db_utils.get_test_node(driver='fake-hardware') self.node = obj_utils.get_test_node(self.ctxt, **self.fake_node) node = objects.Node(self.context, **self.fake_node) node.rescue_interface = None node.obj_reset_changes() node._convert_to_version("1.21", False) self.assertIsNone(node.rescue_interface) self.assertEqual({}, node.obj_get_changes())

commit_message:
Add a data migration to fill node.rescue_interface

This fills node.rescue_interface for hardware type managed nodes to
rescue interface value set in config parameter
'[DEFAULT]/default_rescue_interface'. If it this config parameter is
not set, node.rescue_interface will be populated with 'no-rescue'.

Also adds to existing release note about how rescue_interface is set, to
remind people to check the logic and configs to make sure they get the
expected result.

Change-Id: I0d79400c9e38e22cec30f8059ed0e736fd447994
Partial-bug: #1526449

added_lines: def _pre_upgrade_7a64b77af8e5(self, engine): nodes = db_utils.get_table(engine, 'nodes') data = [{'uuid': uuidutils.generate_uuid(), 'driver': 'fake-hardware', 'rescue_interface': None}, {'uuid': uuidutils.generate_uuid(), 'driver': 'fake', 'rescue_interface': None}, {'uuid': uuidutils.generate_uuid(), 'driver': 'fake-hardware', 'rescue_interface': None}] nodes.insert().values(data).execute() return data def _check_7a64b77af8e5(self, engine, data): nodes = db_utils.get_table(engine, 'nodes') result = engine.execute(nodes.select()) counts = collections.defaultdict(int) def _was_inserted(uuid): for row in data: if row['uuid'] == uuid: return True for row in result: if _was_inserted(row['uuid']): counts[row['rescue_interface']] += 1

commit_message:
WIP: Upgrade pike->queens in superconductor mode

This rolls back the parts from change
If4c82ca12fe7b8b1ca7cfd8181d24dbd8dad3baa which
made grenade upgrade in singleconductor mode.

Change-Id: I005df1a3bc0cbd118689f1667288b5df79c33a23
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/03/509803/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Nova should use singleconductor as Grenade doesn't # setup multi-cell rabbit for now devstack_localrc base "CELLSV2_SETUP=singleconductor" devstack_localrc target "CELLSV2_SETUP=singleconductor" # By the time we get here the sub nodes are already setup with localrc files # as those are transferred in devstack-gate even before grenade.sh is called # We hack the ./post-stack.sh to inject what we need. if we don't set # CELLSV2_SETUP, the default devstack assumes "superconductor" and fails. if # we don't set WSGI_MODE, cinder fails to glance as the glance url is not # set up correctly export SUB_NODE_ENV_VARS="CELLSV2_SETUP=singleconductor" sed -i 's/stdbuf/$SUB_NODE_ENV_VARS stdbuf/' ./post-stack.sh cat ./post-stack.sh

commit_message:
Remove tox unit test warnings

There have been changes to oslo_context which are producing a lot of
annoying warning messages. This patch is an attempt to silent them.

Change-Id: I7c47daebe093ca814a14c972d9d5d53e8103afc9

commit_message:
Use new logic for node name generation

For node to be created with a cluster, this patch adds logic to
generate node name based on cluster config (if provided). If no cluster
is specified, the logic falls back to the old behavior.

Change-Id: I60cff5570cc1cc38f88c44a682b74678639c8d93

commit_message:
Manila network plugin address family support

Set NetworkPluginIpv6Enabled if IPv6 networks
have been enabled.  Currently this parameter and
NetworkPluginIPv4Enabled are mutually exclusive so
set the latter false as well.  Default is IPv4
with NetworkPluginIPv4Enabled.

Depends-On: Ic7e5b5351e429755ba48613ab89d1b7e7d6e2d34
Change-Id: Ia895d7190f0fb8e97c87b3178461d9fc26393b9b

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import config from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib import decorators from patrole_tempest_plugin import rbac_rule_validation from patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.api.volume import rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class SnapshotManageRbacTest(rbac_base.BaseVolumeRbacTest): credentials = ['primary', 'admin'] @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(SnapshotManageRbacTest, cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.volume_feature_enabled.manage_snapshot: raise cls.skipException("Manage snapshot tests are disabled") @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(SnapshotManageRbacTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.snapshot_manage_client = cls.os_primary.snapshot_manage_v2_client cls.admin_snapshots_client = cls.os_admin.snapshots_v3_client @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(SnapshotManageRbacTest, cls).resource_setup() cls.volume = cls.create_volume() cls.snapshot = cls.create_snapshot(volume_id=cls.volume['id']) @decorators.idempotent_id('bd7d62f2-e485-4626-87ef-03b7f19ee1d0') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="cinder", rule="snapshot_extension:snapshot_manage") def test_manage_snapshot_rbac(self): name = data_utils.rand_name(self.__class__.__name__ + '-Managed-Snapshot') description = data_utils.rand_name(self.__class__.__name__ + '-Managed-Snapshot-Description') metadata = {"manage-snap-meta1": "value1", "manage-snap-meta2": "value2", "manage-snap-meta3": "value3"} snapshot_ref = { 'volume_id': self.volume['id'], 'ref': {CONF.volume.manage_snapshot_ref[0]: CONF.volume.manage_snapshot_ref[1] % self.snapshot['id']}, 'name': name, 'description': description, 'metadata': metadata } with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): self.snapshot_manage_client.manage_snapshot(**snapshot_ref) @decorators.idempotent_id('4a2e8934-9c0b-434e-8f0b-e18b9aff126f') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="cinder", rule="snapshot_extension:snapshot_unmanage") def test_unmanage_snapshot_rbac(self): with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): self.snapshots_client.unmanage_snapshot(self.snapshot['id']) self.admin_snapshots_client.wait_for_resource_deletion( self.snapshot['id'])

commit_message:
Add configuration-parameter-show to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the configuration-parameter-show command.

The trove command configuration-parameter-show is now:
    openstack database configuration parameter show

Change-Id: I0a286390135a09b125fab0efa8c83aefec8ca334
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/22/526822/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ShowDatabaseConfigurationParameter(command.ShowOne): _description = _("Shows details of a database configuration parameter.") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ShowDatabaseConfigurationParameter, self).\ get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'datastore_version', metavar='<datastore_version>', help=_('Datastore version name or ID assigned to the' ' configuration group.'), ) parser.add_argument( 'parameter', metavar='<parameter>', help=_('Name of the configuration parameter.'), ) parser.add_argument( '--datastore', metavar='<datastore>', default=None, help=_('ID or name of the datastore to list configuration' ' parameters for. Optional if the ID of the' ' datastore_version is provided.'), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): db_configuration_parameters = self.app.client_manager.database.\ configuration_parameters if parsed_args.datastore: param = db_configuration_parameters.get_parameter( parsed_args.datastore, parsed_args.datastore_version, parsed_args.parameter) elif utils.is_uuid_like(parsed_args.datastore_version): param = db_configuration_parameters.get_parameter_by_version( parsed_args.datastore_version, parsed_args.parameter) else: raise exceptions.NoUniqueMatch(_('The datastore name or id is' ' required to retrieve the' ' parameter for the' ' configuration group' ' by name.')) return zip(*sorted(six.iteritems(param._info)))

commit_message:
Parse deploy_status_code vs status_code in deployment workbook

It looks like the correct name of the output providing the status
code is deploy_status_code not status_code.

Change-Id: Id9772732cb9affadd10d8325f087380a6d9bdb00
Closes-Bug: #1739305

commit_message:
Patch mkisofs calls

The nova unit tests recently started to fail on systems lacking mkisofs
(like mac osx). Skip these mkisofs calls by patching _make_iso9660.

Change-Id: I350aafa878616f74df506c1bc9ee5f26ea06fe97
Closes-Bug: #1630420
(cherry picked from commit b90df7c9c7042d2a8f104f66220f81ecb2951597)

commit_message:
Remove find_stack_traces.py

This commit removes find_stack_traces because the script looks a bit
rotten. For example, it doesn't care about the current 'Guide to
Devstack Gate Logs' page anymore. And this script isn't used any other
projects. One concern is that there are users who are executing this
script by hand. However, this script doesn't work correctly so far. So,
I think users should stop to use this script.

Change-Id: I8b82b3594c94c22e560300a4128f56d5274e082f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/03/526303/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright 2013 IBM Corp. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import gzip import pprint import re import sys import six import six.moves.urllib.request as urlreq pp = pprint.PrettyPrinter() NOVA_TIMESTAMP = r"\d\d\d\d-\d\d-\d\d \d\d:\d\d:\d\d\.\d\d\d" NOVA_REGEX = r"(?P%s) (?P\d+ )?(?P(ERROR|TRACE)) " \ "(?P[\w\.]+) (?P.*)" % (NOVA_TIMESTAMP) class StackTrace(object): timestamp = None pid = None level = "" module = "" msg = "" def __init__(self, timestamp=None, pid=None, level="", module="", msg=""): self.timestamp = timestamp self.pid = pid self.level = level self.module = module self.msg = msg def append(self, msg): self.msg = self.msg + msg def is_same(self, data): return (data['timestamp'] == self.timestamp and data['level'] == self.level) def not_none(self): return self.timestamp is not None def __str__(self): buff = "<%s %s %s> " % (self.timestamp, self.level, self.module) for line in self.msg.splitlines(): buff = buff + line + " " return buff def hunt_for_stacktrace(url): """Return TRACE or ERROR lines out of logs.""" req = urlreq.Request(url) req.add_header('Accept-Encoding', 'gzip') page = urlreq.urlopen(req) buf = six.StringIO(page.read()) f = gzip.GzipFile(fileobj=buf) content = f.read() traces = [] trace = StackTrace() for line in content.splitlines(): m = re.match(NOVA_REGEX, line) if m: data = m.groupdict() if trace.not_none() and trace.is_same(data): trace.append(data['msg'] + " ") else: trace = StackTrace( timestamp=data.get('timestamp'), pid=data.get('pid'), level=data.get('level'), module=data.get('module'), msg=data.get('msg')) else: if trace.not_none(): traces.append(trace) trace = StackTrace() # once more at the end to pick up any stragglers if trace.not_none(): traces.append(trace) return traces def log_url(url, log): return "%s/%s" % (url, log) def collect_logs(url): page = urlreq.urlopen(url) content = page.read() logs = re.findall('(screen-[\w-]+\.txt\.gz)', content) return logs def usage(): print(""" Usage: find_stack_traces.py Hunts for stack traces in a devstack run. Must provide it a base log url from a tempest devstack run. Should start with http and end with /logs/. Returns a report listing stack traces out of the various files where they are found. """) sys.exit(0) def print_stats(items, fname, verbose=False): errors = len([x for x in items if x.level == "ERROR"]) traces = len([x for x in items if x.level == "TRACE"]) print("%d ERRORS found in %s" % (errors, fname)) print("%d TRACES found in %s" % (traces, fname)) if verbose: for item in items: print(item) print(" ") def main(): if len(sys.argv) == 2: url = sys.argv[1] loglist = collect_logs(url) # probably wrong base url if not loglist: usage() for log in loglist: logurl = log_url(url, log) traces = hunt_for_stacktrace(logurl) if traces: print_stats(traces, log, verbose=True) else: usage() if __name__ == '__main__': main()

Bump osc-lib to >= 1.8.0

For example neutronclient would like to consume them.

subject: Update pool member operating status for haproxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-05 00:49:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/db/loadbalancer/loadbalancer_dbv2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/drivers/haproxy/namespace_driver.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/drivers/haproxy/test_namespace_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas/commit/ebc3f735e50aab5cf23eaa67b907687a4ce49b43', 'message': "Update pool member operating status for haproxy

Collection of stats is a period task for which the HAProxy driver also
returns member statuses, including 'status' field which maps to
MemberV2.operating_status. Updating such field in neutron-lbaas DB
ensures the stored operational status is up-to-date. Subsequently, the
operating status of pools, listeners and load balancers can also be
correctly reported to users upon querying in for the load balancer
status tree API.

This fixes cases where a pool member becomes offline in the dataplane
but is not observed in neutron-lbaas. If a member turns back online
again, its operating status will be updated too.

Partial-Bug: #1548774

Change-Id: Ief872b0463002b4e339f8eab71b37a4225d461cc
(cherry picked from commit 80a086695d11aa65251889671a3d729f62779c80)

commit_message:
Update pool member operating status for haproxy

Collection of stats is a period task for which the HAProxy driver also
returns member statuses, including 'status' field which maps to
MemberV2.operating_status. Updating such field in neutron-lbaas DB
ensures the stored operational status is up-to-date. Subsequently, the
operating status of pools, listeners and load balancers can also be
correctly reported to users upon querying in for the load balancer
status tree API.

This fixes cases where a pool member becomes offline in the dataplane
but is not observed in neutron-lbaas. If a member turns back online
again, its operating status will be updated too.

Partial-Bug: #1548774

Change-Id: Ief872b0463002b4e339f8eab71b37a4225d461cc
(cherry picked from commit 80a086695d11aa65251889671a3d729f62779c80)

commit_message:
Drop django_openstack_auth from projects.txt

In Queens cycle, the code of django_openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repository and django_openstack_auth repository will be
retired.

Note that stable branches (pike and ocata) are still maintained
and we need the global-requirements sync for such branches.

Change-Id: If04778ccc99ea92355378d59e616d8794e36ea14

commit_message:
Add support for image caching for the agent driver

Adds several methods to the agent driver to support image caching on
nodes. Includes validation of the presence of arguments to the cache_image
endpoint, marking the node's driver_internal_info dictionary about the
presence of a cached image, asynchronous handling of the caching operation
finishing through the heartbeat method, and several tests surrounding this new
functionality.

There's also some refactoring around creating and deleting Neutron
nodes to reuse code introduced by the agent cleaning driver work.

Implements: image-caching (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/310594/)
Change-Id: I6b577f6a0f3a59ac91e4b6ec980e31390cec3607

This way new drivers don't need to be explicitly defined here

commit_message:
Adding configurability to IRONIC_CALLBACK_TIMEOUT

Devstack-gate is setting IRONIC_CALLBACK_TIMEOUT statically on devstack, but
with the increasing number of 3rd Party CI deployments on Ironic, the
combination of deploy images and user images that can be used to deploy the
specific types of hardware each vendor use may increase the deploy time in
very specific cases. Thus, this option should be configurable.

Change-Id: I139c381eee64d95af28cd0c5e1a650fefa7caa01

commit_message:
Use the new microversion-parse library to parse the version headers

Used the new microversion-parse library (version 0.1.4) to parse the
headers for Ironic

But still need work on using the new microversion-parse library to
parse headers for Ironic-Inspector

Change-Id: I43c25607cd2580a41bb679fd5dfaac40027e7e91
Partial-Bug: #1584718

subject: Moving redfish_version attribute to Field
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-12 09:37:10.000000000', 'files': ['sushy/utils.py', 'sushy/resources/manager/manager.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/test_main.py', 'sushy/main.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/resources/system/test_processor.py', 'sushy/resources/base.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/resources/manager/test_manager.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'sushy/resources/system/system.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/resources/test_base.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/resources/system/test_system.py', 'sushy/resources/system/processor.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/783e58b204ddc0271d32fe6113df74c67f7edaeb', 'message': 'Moving redfish_version attribute to Field

Till now the property 'redfish_version' was getting picked up
from root resource response and was getting passed down to all
resources while creation from Sushy class. This patch changes
the way this attribute picks its value from for any resource.

All resources in their response shall include a type property
named "@odata.type". This will contain the version-ised
namespace name of the Redfish Schema in which the type is
defined. The Field-ified 'redfish_version' property will now
get its value from this version string of this namespace value.

Change-Id: I0cde44b4f9c355a18ca5f79c4fb4b9d352a04be0
'}]
commit_message:
Moving redfish_version attribute to Field

Till now the property 'redfish_version' was getting picked up
from root resource response and was getting passed down to all
resources while creation from Sushy class. This patch changes
the way this attribute picks its value from for any resource.

All resources in their response shall include a type property
named "@odata.type". This will contain the version-ised
namespace name of the Redfish Schema in which the type is
defined. The Field-ified 'redfish_version' property will now
get its value from this version string of this namespace value.

Change-Id: I0cde44b4f9c355a18ca5f79c4fb4b9d352a04be0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/39/473339/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, connector, identity): super(Processor, self).__init__(connector, identity) def __init__(self, connector, path): super(ProcessorCollection, self).__init__(connector, path)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, connector, identity, redfish_version=None): :param redfish_version: The version of RedFish. Used to construct the object according to schema of the given version. super(Processor, self).__init__(connector, identity, redfish_version) def __init__(self, connector, path, redfish_version=None): :param redfish_version: The version of RedFish. Used to construct the object according to schema of the given version. super(ProcessorCollection, self).__init__(connector, path, redfish_version)

commit_message:
Add 'GET /nodes/<node>/cleaning/steps' API request

Add 'GET /nodes/<node_ident>/cleaning/steps' API request that
returns a list of the cleaning steps that are available for a
particular node.

Partial-Bug: #1526290
Co-Authored-By: Debayan Ray <debayan.ray@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If2231f271e93ee4412e6a8d1d5bb3f8d7c36142d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/66/278566/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: | 1.33 - Add get_clean_steps RPC_API_VERSION = '1.33' def get_clean_steps(self, context, node_id, topic=None, min_priority=0): """Get the list of clean steps available for a node. :param context: request context. :param node_id: node id or uuid. :param topic: RPC topic. Defaults to self.topic. :param min_priority: The minimum priority value of the clean steps :raises: NodeNotFound if the node no longer appears in the database. :raises: NodeGetCleanStepsFailure if there is a failure to get the cleaning steps. :returns: a list of clean steps """ cctxt = self.client.prepare(topic=topic or self.topic, version='1.33') return cctxt.call(context, 'get_clean_steps', node_id=node_id, min_priority=min_priority)

subject: Prepare for functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 09:02:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/5ac3e58cf5f24c32b4b72335e8f50b781fd6cfe6', 'message': 'Prepare for functional tests

Functional test is not enabled in Ironic. But many unit
tests are over tested because they are not faking anything,
but actually started a real pecan server to do the tests.

Bug #1607679 aims to split them. This patch could be the
first step of it.

DbTestCase and BaseApiTest are base classes for functional
tests. They should be put in functional dir. This patch
copy them to functional dir instead of moving so that we
can keep the current unit tests code untouched. And when
we finish to grab all the functional tests out, we can
simply remove the ones in unit dir.

This patch also enables functional tests in tox.ini. And
the follow-up patches can easily do functional tests.

Change-Id: Ib58635aa7f8518632053338f7d83e1bdb593bfc4
Partial-bug: #1607679
Partial-bug: #1491670
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 11:11:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/4ae900fb7bead04afcbed5b6f4475e37a968ba3f', 'message': 'Prepare for functional tests

tests are over tested because they are not faking anything,
but actually start a real pecan server to do the tests.

Bug #1607679 aims to split them. This patch could be the
first step of it.

DbTestCase and BaseApiTest are base classes for functional
tests. They should be put in functional dir. This patch
copies them to functional dir instead of moving so that we
can keep the current unit tests code untouched. And when
we finish to grab all the functional tests out, we can
simply remove the ones in unit dir.

This patch also enables functional tests in tox.ini. And
the follow-up patches can easily add more functional tests.

And also, this patch also does some refactor for api/base.py.

Functional test is not enabled in Ironic. But many unit
tests are over tested because they are not faking anything,
but actually start a real pecan server to do the tests.

Bug #1607679 aims to split them. This patch could be the
first step of it.

DbTestCase and BaseApiTest are base classes for functional
tests. They should be put in functional dir. This patch
copies them to functional dir instead of moving so that we
can keep the current unit tests code untouched. And when
we finish to grab all the functional tests out, we can
simply remove the ones in unit dir.

This patch also enables functional tests in tox.ini. And
the follow-up patches can easily add more functional tests.

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-09 05:47:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/857e137e8a434cdcc72553dd18193f493a74c5a5', 'message': 'Prepare for functional tests

Functional test is not enabled in Ironic. But many unit
tests are over tested because they are not faking anything,
but actually start a real pecan server to do the tests.

Bug #1607679 aims to split them. This patch could be the
first step of it.

DbTestCase and BaseApiTest are base classes for functional
tests. They should be put in functional dir. This patch
copies them to functional dir instead of moving so that we
can keep the current unit tests code untouched. And when
we finish to grab all the functional tests out, we can
simply remove the ones in unit dir.

This patch also enables functional tests in tox.ini. And
the follow-up patches can easily add more functional tests.

And also, this patch also does some refactor for api/base.py.

Change-Id: Ib58635aa7f8518632053338f7d83e1bdb593bfc4
Depends-On: Ia6d050bf47c70c12589d74b88128419024a95622
Partial-bug: #1607679
Partial-bug: #1491670

commit_message:
Prepare for functional tests

Functional test is not enabled in Ironic. But many unit
tests are over tested because they are not faking anything,
but actually start a real pecan server to do the tests.

Bug #1607679 aims to split them. This patch could be the
first step of it.

DbTestCase and BaseApiTest are base classes for functional
tests. They should be put in functional dir. This patch
copies them to functional dir instead of moving so that we
can keep the current unit tests code untouched. And when
we finish to grab all the functional tests out, we can
simply remove the ones in unit dir.

This patch also enables functional tests in tox.ini. And
the follow-up patches can easily add more functional tests.

And also, in ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_root.py, routing
test is more like a functional test because it is
based on a real runing pecan server. But check_version
test is just a unit test. So we move routing test
to functional dir. We should add at least a functional test
here to avoid error when running "tox -e functional".

This patch does the least refactor to base.py. And will do
more when the moving job has finished.

Co-Authored-By: jiangwei <wei.jiang@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Ib58635aa7f8518632053338f7d83e1bdb593bfc4
Partial-bug: #1607679
Partial-bug: #1491670
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/21/349421/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Ironic DB test base class.""" import os import shutil import fixtures from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import enginefacade from ironic.common import paths from ironic.db import api as dbapi from ironic.db.sqlalchemy import migration from ironic.db.sqlalchemy import models from ironic.tests import base CONF = cfg.CONF _DB_CACHE = None class Database(fixtures.Fixture): def __init__(self, engine, db_migrate, sql_connection, sqlite_db, sqlite_clean_db): self.sql_connection = sql_connection self.sqlite_db = sqlite_db self.sqlite_clean_db = sqlite_clean_db self.engine = engine self.engine.dispose() conn = self.engine.connect() if sql_connection == "sqlite://": self.setup_sqlite(db_migrate) elif sql_connection.startswith('sqlite:///'): testdb = paths.state_path_rel(sqlite_db) if os.path.exists(testdb): return self.setup_sqlite(db_migrate) else: db_migrate.upgrade('head') self.post_migrations() if sql_connection == "sqlite://": conn = self.engine.connect() self._DB = "".join(line for line in conn.connection.iterdump()) self.engine.dispose() else: cleandb = paths.state_path_rel(sqlite_clean_db) shutil.copyfile(testdb, cleandb) def setup_sqlite(self, db_migrate): if db_migrate.version(): return models.Base.metadata.create_all(self.engine) db_migrate.stamp('head') def setUp(self): super(Database, self).setUp() if self.sql_connection == "sqlite://": conn = self.engine.connect() conn.connection.executescript(self._DB) self.addCleanup(self.engine.dispose) else: shutil.copyfile(paths.state_path_rel(self.sqlite_clean_db), paths.state_path_rel(self.sqlite_db)) self.addCleanup(os.unlink, self.sqlite_db) def post_migrations(self): """Any addition steps that are needed outside of the migrations.""" class DbTestCase(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(DbTestCase, self).setUp() self.dbapi = dbapi.get_instance() global _DB_CACHE if not _DB_CACHE: engine = enginefacade.get_legacy_facade().get_engine() _DB_CACHE = Database(engine, migration, sql_connection=CONF.database.connection, sqlite_db=CONF.database.sqlite_db, sqlite_clean_db='clean.sqlite') self.useFixture(_DB_CACHE)

commit_message:
Add validation for portgroup mode

This patch adds a validation for portgroup mode which can be any
one of:

* balance-rr
* 802.3ad
* active-backup
* balance-xor
* broadcast
* balance-alb
* balance-tlb

Please refer https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/bonding.txt
for more details.

Change-Id: I0fbacf3776ac086c95198ae08a2128dc88f5308c
Closes-Bug: #1701156

commit_message:
Fix stable states validation in FSM

States ENROLL and ERROR should not be set as target states, they are
removed from states.STABLE_STATES. This change fixes behavior of
_validate_target_state() FSM method. Description of STABLE_STATES
updated.

Change-Id: I734de0be535eeb4a612265ce5893ec511f9f4327

commit_message:
Add UUID validation to port and portgroup PATCH methods.

Fix node_id being passed to node_uuid setters for port and portgroup
in PATCH methods. Instead, node is retrieved and its UUID is passed.
Add validation of value passed to these setters.
Allowed types are now UUID and Unset.

Fix portgroup_id being passed to portgroup_uuid setters for port
in PATCH method. Instead, portgroup is retrieved and its UUID is passed.
Add validation of value passed to portgroup_uuid setter.
Allowed types are now UUID, Unset and None.

Change-Id: Ic988a5e903279b38a82f195c58055036dafba8ff
Closes-Bug: #1301046
Signed-off-by: Joanna Taryma <joanna.taryma@intel.com>

added_lines: from oslo_utils import uuidutils if uuidutils.is_uuid_like(value): try: node = objects.Node.get_by_uuid(pecan.request.context, value) self._node_uuid = value # NOTE(lucasagomes): Create the node_id attribute on-the-fly # to satisfy the api -> rpc object # conversion. # response for a POST request to create a Port e.code = http_client.BAD_REQUEST # BadRequest raise elif value == wtypes.Unset: self._node_uuid = value else: raise exception.InvalidUUID(uuid=str(value)) self.fields.append('node_uuid') node_uuid = kwargs.get('node_uuid') if not node_uuid: node_id = kwargs.get('node_id') if node_id: try: node = objects.Node.get_by_id(pecan.request.context, node_id) self.node_id = node.id # NOTE(jtaryma): skip calling setter to avoid retrieving # node once again self._node_uuid = node.uuid except exception.NodeNotFound as e: # Change error code because 404 (NotFound) is inappropriate # response for a POST request to create a Port e.code = http_client.BAD_REQUEST # BadRequest raise else: setattr(self, 'node_uuid', wtypes.Unset) else: setattr(self, 'node_uuid', node_uuid) rpc_node = objects.Node.get_by_id(pecan.request.context, portgroup_dict.pop('node_id')) portgroup_dict['node_uuid'] = rpc_node.uuid

commit_message:
Add glean package in requirements.txt

Glean is a simple program to build a system from configuration
provided in a configuration drive.
This patch adds Glean in requirements.txt so that later the
program can be used to write static config from configuration drive.

Change-Id: I824eff463194c20e8da23cd762488cd38741bea3

commit_message:
Adds functionality test for erase_devices

This commit adds the support to test the clean
step erase_devices functionally as a manual
clean step.

Change-Id: I712548501c24018adcd0f86b6399d60ba538abd9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/58/472558/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestCleanSteps(bsm.BaremetalStandaloneManager, """This tests the clean steps on the node""" def prepare_node_for_cleaning(self): """Prepare the node for cleaning.""" node = self.get_and_reserve_node() self.update_node_driver(node['uuid'], self.driver) network, subnet, router = self.create_networks() n_port = self.create_neutron_port(network_id=network['id']) self.vif_attach(node_id=node['uuid'], vif_id=n_port['id']) return node """This tests the raid configuration settings on the node. The following steps are followed as part of testing: * Pick a random available node. * Assign the raid configuration to the selected node * Perform cleaning with assigned raid configuration * Verify the raid configuration * Bring back the node to available state NOTE: RAID hardware manager should be part of the deploy ramdisk/iso """ @test.idempotent_id('d85858c4-4ccc-11e7-8d40-2b966933fc3c') @test.services('image', 'network') def test_baremetal_erase_devices(self): """This tests the erase devices clean step on the node.""" clean_steps = [ { "interface": "deploy", "step": "erase_devices" } ] base.set_baremetal_api_microversion('latest') node = self.prepare_node_for_cleaning() self.check_manual_cleaning(node, clean_steps) base.reset_baremetal_api_microversion()
deleted_lines: class TestRaidConfig(bsm.BaremetalStandaloneManager, """This tests the raid configuration settings on the node. The following steps are followed as part of testing: * Pick a random available node. * Assign the raid configuration to the selected node * Perform cleaning with assigned raid configuration * Verify the raid configuration * Bring back the node to available state NOTE: RAID hardware manager should be part of the deploy ramdisk/iso """

commit_message:
Adds functionality test for hpsum based firmware update

This commit adds the tempest test case for update_firmware
clean step in hpsum mode.

Depends-On: I581d5bc535420d4493394d16cf6cc2bb0ddeb8f7
Change-Id: Id81bd4f8bf3bd43676e75cd7a3ab1fd24162a871

added_lines: # # Copyright 2017 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging from tempest import config from tempest import test from ironic_tempest_plugin.services.baremetal import base from ironic_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario import \ baremetal_manager as bm from ironic_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario import \ baremetal_standalone_manager as bsm LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CONF = config.CONF class TestFirmwareUpdate(bsm.BaremetalStandaloneManager, bm.BaremetalScenarioTest): driver = 'agent_ilo' image_ref = CONF.baremetal.whole_disk_image_ref wholedisk_image = True @test.idempotent_id('549173a5-38ec-42bb-b0e2-c8b9f4a08943') @test.services('image', 'network') def test_baremetal_hpsum_firmware_update(self): clean_steps = [ { "interface": "management", "step": "hpsum_firmware_update", "args": CONF.baremetal.clean_step_args } ] self.addCleanup(base.set_baremetal_api_microversion('latest')) node = self.prepare_node(self.driver) self.check_manual_cleaning(node, clean_steps) self.addCleanup(base.reset_baremetal_api_microversion())

subject: Remove /etc/machine-id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-17 08:41:21.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/cleanup.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/loci/commit/2fa935d8cd081923728bc4d820207f535e44121d', 'message': 'Remove /etc/machine-id

This file will cause problems with running distros that are based on
systemd on distros that do not have systemd (ie runnign 16.04 on 14.04).
This file need not exist in the container anyway as it is empty

Change-Id: I4487e160077c64ed4b5d9561483f25c3a37bd455
'}]
commit_message:
Remove /etc/machine-id

This file will cause problems with running distros that are based on
systemd on distros that do not have systemd (ie runnign 16.04 on 14.04).
This file need not exist in the container anyway as it is empty

Change-Id: I4487e160077c64ed4b5d9561483f25c3a37bd455
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/loci refs/changes/34/528534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix Makefile

This patch sets fixes the make clean target as it currently attempts
to delete the generated */charts up the parents, where the directory
is guaranteed to be non-empty.

Change-Id: Id1327998cc1cdc73bdf0113d5ec68330d9fc70f0

commit_message:
Use generic netcat syntax in base scenario

Current syntax only works with busybox netcat, directly call the script
after making it executable so it works with all versions of netcat (and
all base test images)

Change-Id: I398ab7147faf9487f157930c5bf4da0448f96527

commit_message:
Use native Zuul v3 tox jobs

Convert all tox jobs to be Zuul v3 native. This uses the shared
openstack-tox as base.

Remove the now unused playbooks.

Change-Id: Ic89940a03e308fab051b8051ff281724e6488306

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

tox_install.sh was also building ovs for functional test. Move this into
tools/setup-ovs.sh and call it from functional tox environment.

Change-Id: I5857c8ae3e945328c0f24bda37629ce7e0faefa7

commit_message:
[WIP] Enhance neutron plugin to use the neutron ironic port mapping

This is a prototype implementation on the ironic side for the proposed
neutron-ironic port mapping function. It's based on the ironic neutron
plugin that's currently in review, but trying to solve the following
issue:

-- which ironic port/portgroup should be used for the provisioning and
   cleaning networks
-- which ironic port/portgroup should be used for a particular neutron
   tenant network

With the help of neutron ironic port mapping function, neutron
vif_id is no longer needed to be cached in the ironic port object.

To use as much as the existing code, the vif_id for the provisioning
network or the cleaning network is cached in the node object.

Related-Bug: 1552364

Change-Id: I7accc2afcd3db708a65054530ab3ea42272549f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/84/287384/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vifs['ports'] = {task.node.extra['ironic_port_id']: task.node.extra['neutron_port_id']} LOG.debug('ironic_port_id: %(ir_pid)s, neutron_port_id: %(ne_pid)s', {'ir_pid': task.node.extra['ironic_port_id'], 'ne_pid': task.node.extra['neutron_port_id']})def _find_matching_ironic_object(portgroups, ports, matching_val, is_physnet=True): # Right now, assume that there is only one ironic port group or # in the non VPC case, one ironic port per physical # network on a node. A port group's physical network is the same # as its members. Also, a port group is preferred over a port for pg in portgroups: member_ports = [] swinfo = [] for port in ports: if is_physnet: my_val = port.extra.get('physical_network') else: my_val = port.address if (port.portgroup_id == pg.id and my_val == matching_val): member_ports.append(port) swinfo.append(port.local_link_connection) if member_ports: return pg, member_ports, swinfo for port in ports: if is_physnet: my_val = port.extra.get('physical_network') else: my_val = port.address if my_val == matching_val: return port, [], [port.local_link_connection] # Find the physical network associated with this neutron network # This should be done only once, but let's deal with that later net = client.show_network(network_uuid, fields='provider:physical_network').get('network') physnet = net.get('provider:physical_network') LOG.debug('portgroups: %(pg)s, ports: %(p)s, ' 'matching physical net: %(pn)s', {'pg': task.portgroups, 'p': task.ports, 'pn': physnet}) ironic_obj, member_ports, swinfo = _find_matching_ironic_object( task.portgroups, task.ports, physnet) LOG.debug('Matching ironic object: %(obj)s, members: %(members)s', {'obj': ironic_obj, 'members': member_ports}) 'mac_address': ironic_obj.address, 'binding:profile': {'local_link_information': swinfo}, try: port = client.create_port(body) except neutron_exceptions.ConnectionFailed as e: rollback_ports(task, network_uuid) msg = (_('Could not create port on given network %(net)s ' 'from %(node)s. %(exc)s') % {'net': network_uuid, 'node': task.node.uuid, 'exc': e}) LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.NetworkError(msg) extra_dict = task.node.extra or {} extra_dict['neutron_port_id'] = port['port']['id'] extra_dict['ironic_port_id'] = ironic_obj.uuid task.node.extra = extra_dict task.node.save() return [port] extra_dict = task.node.extra client.delete_port(extra_dict['neutron_port_id']) del extra_dict['neutron_port_id'] del extra_dict['ironic_port_id'] task.node.extra = extra_dict task.node.save()
deleted_lines: portgroup_vifs = {} port_vifs = {} for portgroup in task.portgroups: vif = portgroup.extra.get('vif_port_id') if vif: portgroup_vifs[portgroup.uuid] = vif vifs['portgroups'] = portgroup_vifs for port in task.ports: vif = port.extra.get('vif_port_id') if vif: port_vifs[port.uuid] = vif vifs['ports'] = port_vifs ports = {} portmap = get_node_portmap(task) for ironic_port in task.ports: body['port']['mac_address'] = ironic_port.address binding_profile = {'local_link_information': [portmap[ironic_port.uuid]]} body['port']['binding:profile'] = binding_profile try: port = client.create_port(body) except neutron_exceptions.ConnectionFailed as e: rollback_ports(task, network_uuid) msg = (_('Could not create port on given network %(net)s ' 'from %(node)s. %(exc)s') % {'net': network_uuid, 'node': task.node.uuid, 'exc': e}) LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.NetworkError(msg) if not port.get('port') or not port['port'].get('id'): rollback_ports(task, network_uuid) msg = (_('Failed to create port on given network %(net)s ' 'from %(node)s.') % {'net': network_uuid, 'node': task.node.uuid}) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.NetworkError(msg) extra_dict = ironic_port.extra # Backup existing vif vif = extra_dict.pop('vif_port_id', None) if vif: extra_dict['tenant_vif_port_id'] = vif failures = [] # Setting provisioning port as the vif for the ironic port. try: extra_dict['vif_port_id'] = port['port']['id'] except KeyError: # This is an internal error in Ironic. All DHCP providers # implementing create_cleaning_ports are supposed to # return a VIF port ID for all Ironic ports. But # that doesn't seem to be true here. failures.append(vif) else: ironic_port.extra = extra_dict ironic_port.save() # Match return value of get_node_vif_ids() ports[ironic_port.uuid] = port['port']['id'] if failures: if len(failures) == len(task.ports): raise exception.FailedToUpdateVIFPortIdOptOnPort(_( "Failed to update vif_port_id for any port " "on node %s.") % task.node.uuid) else: LOG.warning(_LW("Some errors were encountered when updating " "vif_port_id for node %(node)s on " "the following vifs: %(vifs)s."), {'node': task.node.uuid, 'vifs': failures}) return ports macs = [p.address for p in task.ports] params = { 'network_id': network_uuid, } try: ports = client.list_ports(**params) except neutron_exceptions.ConnectionFailed as e: msg = (_('Could not get given network vif for %(node)s ' 'from Neutron, possible network issue. %(exc)s') % {'node': task.node.uuid, 'exc': e}) LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.NetworkError(msg) # Iterate the list of Neutron port dicts, remove the ones we added for neutron_port in ports.get('ports', []): # Only delete ports using the node's mac addresses if neutron_port.get('mac_address') in macs: try: client.delete_port(neutron_port.get('id')) except neutron_exceptions.ConnectionFailed as e: msg = (_('Could not remove ports on given network ' '%(net)s from %(node)s, possible network issue. ' '%(exc)s') % {'net': network_uuid, 'node': task.node.uuid, 'exc': e}) LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.NetworkError(msg)

'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2017-04-26 10:47:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/9a57ae0267144f4d7d4e451ad690dba0a182946d', 'message': "Extend api to accept qos_policy_id

This patch extend Octavia v2 API to access qos_policy_id from neutron.
Users can pass it as 'vip_qos_policy_id' to Octavia request body to
create/update Loadbalancers, and the vrrp ports will have the qos
abilities.

This patch modify the LoadbalancerPost/Put request body and response
body. And extend the 'vip' table with an new column named
'qos_policy_id' to store the qos_id from neutron. Add ApplyQos task in
loadbalancer_post_task_flows and loadbalancer_update_task_flows.
Then add some Uts and api tests.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>

Change-Id: I43aba9d2ae816b1498d16da077936d6bdb62e30a

"}, {'number': 27, 'created': '2017-06-23 03:39:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/bc30227c128587d478e3cdce56918656b6b7faa8', 'message': "Extend api to accept qos_policy_id

This patch extend Octavia v2 API to access qos_policy_id from neutron.
Users can pass it as 'vip_qos_policy_id' to Octavia request body to
create/update Loadbalancers, and the vrrp ports will have the qos
abilities.

This patch modifies the Loadbalancer Post/Put request body and response
body. It also extends the 'vip' table with the new column named
'qos_policy_id' to store the qos_id from neutron.

ToDo:
Add ApplyQos task in loadbalancer_post_task_flows and loadbalancer_update_task_flows.
Then add some Uts and api tests.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>

Change-Id: I43aba9d2ae816b1498d16da077936d6bdb62e30a

commit_message:
Extend api to accept qos_policy_id

This patch extend Octavia v2 API to access qos_policy_id from neutron.
Users can pass it as 'vip_qos_policy_id' to Octavia request body to
create/update Loadbalancers, and the vrrp ports will have the qos
abilities.

This patch modifies the Loadbalancer Post/Put request body and response
body. It also extends the 'vip' table with the new column named
'qos_policy_id' to store the qos_id from neutron.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>

Change-Id: I43aba9d2ae816b1498d16da077936d6bdb62e30a

commit_message:
Add new "amttool" driver based on amttool.pl script

The "amtterm" project provides a simple Perl script for interacting
with AMT v7 and v8 hardware. This utility is available from the
"amtterm" package on Ubuntu 14.04 (and other distros), and was imported
previously in commit I6cfb4c804af00cfeb364017566e21b9c34cb6316

This commit implements simple Power and Management interfaces, and
bindings for PXE and Agent deploy methods.

Change-Id: I51fa7147a642c01953169edd61058d09e15a6e5f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/67/193767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ironic.drivers.modules import amttoolclass PXEAndAMTToolDriver(base.BaseDriver): """PXE + AMTTool driver. This driver implements the 'core' functionality, combining :class:`ironic.drivers.amttool.AMTPower` for power management with :class:`ironic.drivers.pxe.PXE` for image deployment. Implementations are in those respective classes; this class is merely the glue between them. """ def __init__(self): self.power = amttool.AMTPower() self.deploy = pxe.PXEDeploy() self.management = amttool.AMTManagement() self.vendor = pxe.VendorPassthru()

commit_message:
Make a few changes to amttool.pl

A few changes to the imported perl script were necessary to facilitate
ease of use:
- remove the required interactive prompt
- add a minimal "powerinfo" command

Change-Id: I114ad1d1119aa0cb1798f7da5d29f08022865f70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/66/193766/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: powerinfo - print power status sub print_power_info() { my $powerstate = $rcs->GetSystemPowerState()->paramsout; printf "Powerstate: %s\n", $ps [ $powerstate & 0x0f ]; } push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('Command' => $rcc{$command})); push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('IanaOemNumber' => 343)); if (defined($special) && defined($rccs{$special})) { push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('SpecialCommand' => $rccs{$special} )); } if (defined($special) && defined($rccs_oem{$special})) { push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('SpecialCommand' => $rccs_oem{$special} )); push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('OEMparameters' => 1 )); } do_soap($rcs, "RemoteControl", @args);} elsif ($amt_command eq "powerinfo") { print_power_info;
deleted_lines: printf "host %s.%s, %s [y/N] ? ", $hostname, $domainname, $command; my $reply = <>; if ($reply =~ m/^(y|yes)$/i) { printf "execute: %s\n", $command; push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('Command' => $rcc{$command})); push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('IanaOemNumber' => 343)); if (defined($special) && defined($rccs{$special})) { push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('SpecialCommand' => $rccs{$special} )); } if (defined($special) && defined($rccs_oem{$special})) { push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('SpecialCommand' => $rccs_oem{$special} )); push (@args, SOAP::Data->name('OEMparameters' => 1 )); } do_soap($rcs, "RemoteControl", @args); } else { printf "canceled\n"; }

commit_message:
Fix Increase guest agent cmd process timeout

A previous commit attempted to set the guest agent command
process timeout value high but had a copy-paste error in
the line that actually sets the environment variable value
into the guest conf file.

This fixes the copy-paste issue.

Change-Id: Ib8aa566fb34eb52e2541d0ccb595234373e01bc2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/35/527135/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Prometheus: Update values to be yaml rather than freeform text

This PS udpates the Prometheus values to use yaml rather than text.

It also consolates all configuration into a single `etc` configmap,
inline with other OSH charts.

Change-Id: I162d4817a2b1b842499ef27d754707f8fce23bf3

commit_message:
cfg.CONF must not be used directly

cfg.CONF must not be used directly, Config().oslo_conf_obj must be used
instead.

Closes-bug: #1737119

Change-Id: I58ec9e25c7f04a8352535d8861e09c7e4c4c0a9d

commit_message:
Ignore wheels that exist natively whl upstream

This prevents ~200MB of needless pypi downloading and speeds up the
build process, esspecially in environments without a PyPI mirror.

Change-Id: Icb36ad752923730f5daca22ef08455551e1161a8

commit_message:
Remove policy.json file

We already had default rule in code, so we should not
still define all of them again in policy file.
Besides, we should you yaml format for now instead json.

Another thing, we don't need to config policy file in
Devstack enviroment.

Change-Id: I783ba51695271d358764557899fe91e84620556d

commit_message:
ansible: handle mount of /sys the same way IPA does it

* Mount with -t sysfs instead of a bind mount
* Retry umounting of each directory several times.

I'm seeing occasional failures unmounting /sys, as it's still busy.
This patch should fix it.

Change-Id: I4bc6dfd6939699f7a4ed7cc59e2e503b46bbaeaf

added_lines: From 287ba761c233235aec0dc27dd01f914dd390bd28 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de> Date: Mon, 18 Dec 2017 22:36:09 +0100 Subject: [PATCH] Use mock for HTTP calls in unit tests In test environment without network access, test_retry_policy_from_var failed to run as it was not expecting the DNS lookup error. Mocking the HTTP calls instead helps getting this pass. Change-Id: I050aba6a90dc13200e1cded2195bdf5caf43367b --- mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_policies.py | 15 +++++++++++++++ 1 file changed, 15 insertions(+) diff --git a/mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_policies.py b/mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_policies.py index fddf16ec..af17e7ea 100644 --- a/mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_policies.py +++ b/mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_policies.py @@ -722,6 +722,11 @@ class PoliciesTest(base.EngineTestCase): self.assertNotIn("retry_task_policy", task_ex.runtime_context) + @mock.patch.object( + requests, + 'request', + mock.MagicMock(side_effect=Exception()) + ) def test_retry_policy_negative_numbers(self): # Negative delay is not accepted. self.assertRaises( @@ -776,6 +781,11 @@ class PoliciesTest(base.EngineTestCase): task_ex.runtime_context["retry_task_policy"]["retry_no"] ) + @mock.patch.object( + requests, + 'request', + mock.MagicMock(side_effect=Exception()) + ) def test_retry_policy_from_var_zero_iterations(self): wb_service.create_workbook_v2(RETRY_WB_FROM_VAR) @@ -809,6 +819,11 @@ class PoliciesTest(base.EngineTestCase): self.assertNotIn("retry_task_policy", task_ex.runtime_context) + @mock.patch.object( + requests, + 'request', + mock.MagicMock(side_effect=Exception()) + ) def test_retry_policy_from_var_negative_numbers(self): wb_service.create_workbook_v2(RETRY_WB_FROM_VAR) -- 2.15.0

commit_message:
Add cluster-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the cluster-delete command.

The trove command cluster-delete is now:
    openstack database cluster delete

Change-Id: Ibf8f0670231799508a902cffd332c844584ed407
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Use 'functional' tox environment

Rename 'func' to 'functional' tox environment and replace custom
legacy func job with cross-project 'openstack-tox-functional' job.

Change-Id: I2a774a0a9870163457d1e7bc9c2976a9680ace01

commit_message:
Add the list of hw_version supported by vmware driver.

This patch add the list of hw_version supported by vmware driver.
The corresponding relationships are as following:
vmx-13: ESXi6.5
vmx-11: ESXi6.0
vmx-10: ESXi5.5
vmx-09: ESXi5.1
vmx-08: ESXi5.0
vmx-07: ESXi/ESX4.x
vmx-04: ESX3.x
vmx-03: ESX2.x

Change-Id: I1796b461855081f758b0585c9a0165c5138669d5

commit_message:
Use parameter to control the docker registry env file creation

By setting force: no the created script files are rendered only
once. The role should allow multiple runs and update the scripts
according to the latest options passed by the user. This change
controls the scripts creation by vars in order to be able to
create or not the script files.

Change-Id: I1594ddfda11ac638ba65625964c0a492ad9e6e18

commit_message:
Add datastore-version-show to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the datastore-version-show command.

The trove command datastore-version-show is now:
    openstack datastore version show

Change-Id: I14844d887565bc58d44181db7ed3da454dc574d0
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

subject: Devstack: Move baremeteal flavor creation back into devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-17 20:10:11.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/baremetal_manager.py', 'devstack/lib/ironic'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/21e7e275e20b6aea9c3cbb4a0df6343a2654d395', 'message': "Devstack: Move baremeteal flavor creation back into devstack

Ironic started to use devstack plugin. That caused a bug cause there was
no away to run stack phases on the ironic plugin before tempestcause
tempest is in-tree service right now, and thus tempest stop honoring the
DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE=baremetal set on ironic jobs.

This change aims, along w/ I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c, in
tempest, and I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1, in devstack, to
fix that by moving the baremetal flavor creation back into lib/tempest
(which makes sense since it's a resource that tempest uses, not ironic)
and *using* a new option in tempest baremetal.instance_type that will be
used exclusively for ironic tests (similar idea at tempest's tree for
orchestration.instance_type).

Change-Id: I3bdf46afc4c67433cd66bee7aed278f51b544941
Depends-on: I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1
Depends-on: I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c
Partial-bug: #1546706
"}]
commit_message:
Devstack: Move baremeteal flavor creation back into devstack

Ironic started to use devstack plugin. That caused a bug cause there was
no away to run stack phases on the ironic plugin before tempestcause
tempest is in-tree service right now, and thus tempest stop honoring the
DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE=baremetal set on ironic jobs.

This change aims, along w/ I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c, in
tempest, and I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1, in devstack, to
fix that by moving the baremetal flavor creation back into lib/tempest
(which makes sense since it's a resource that tempest uses, not ironic)
and *using* a new option in tempest baremetal.instance_type that will be
used exclusively for ironic tests (similar idea at tempest's tree for
orchestration.instance_type).

Change-Id: I3bdf46afc4c67433cd66bee7aed278f51b544941
Depends-on: I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1
Depends-on: I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c
Partial-bug: #1546706

commit_message:
Termination Panel and Token handler

The panel is under settings, and gives options for both
deleteing an account and simply clearing resources.

The token handler for clearing an account simply confirms it,
whereas for deleting an account it also confirms that they do want
to remove their project instead of just clearing all of their
resources.

Change-Id: Ib85bd498c19b37e007383b143ac5f263ec7f0f62

commit_message:
Correct typo in manila/share.pp resource chaining

A typo error resulted in an attempted resource chaining of
Ceph::Key[client.manila] to Exec[exec-setfacl-manila-manila]. The
actual exec resource is Exec[exec-setfacl-manila]

Change-Id: I78eec6022211b0e82c06599dea300961a2309f0c

commit_message:
Small refactor of translation scripts

The modulename parameter for setup_projects are not needed anymore,
their usage has been removed with retirement of mitaka. Remove these
parameter.

Call setup_project only once per project and not for both python and
django setup. Also, move the zanata pull out to not have to create a
lock.

Change-Id: Iaf58a6882527eee3ce6528b516fe0f24f51cd976

commit_message:
Add instance-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the instance-delete command.

The trove command delete is now:
    openstack database instance delete

Change-Id: Id052d14190e9fbdfe10db4e043fa78d6aef83ba9
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Add possibility to inspect systems with multiple CPUs

This feature gives possibility to inspect each CPU separately
and to get info about each of them.

In inspected cpu info now contains list of CPU objects.

Change-Id: Id93b8ffcd1cf058e881ca4e888d1fd56466c156a

commit_message:
Added Parameter horizon_upload_mode

Adds a new Puppet parameter "horizon_upload_mode" which goes into
the local_settings.py configuration file and allows to change
the parameter "HORIZON_IMAGES_UPLOAD_MODE"
to one of "legacy", "off" or "direct" (default is "legacy").

Change-Id: I2e36227d318dd74267ad23f14595481b379cbbd6
Closes-Bug: 1738814

commit_message:
Not depending on bash

Allowing to use the agent without bash shell,
just requiring POSIX compatible shell.

The used scripts are able to work without modification with most shell,
but since the '[[' ']]' just on optional part of POSIX shell they are changed to
'[' usage.

This change also adds extra quotes to several variables.

Change-Id: Ia0cd39cc346db789f4307787038096ad842dff51

commit_message:
clean up non-install parts of contributor docs

- remove specific comments about preferring notifications v. polling
just say, polling can add load
- remove kafka publisher reference
- remove database publisher reference
- move key links (wiki, launchpad, ml, etc...) to index
- put all meter details in one area
- clean up testing

Change-Id: I1993a9945334ffe631f2ddb3dcd0316d0e71f258
(cherry picked from commit 48751822dd1fad3c652cd1a5cc9a60c6a2a15fb8)

deleted_lines: notification bus and transforms them into Ceilometer samples or events. This is **the preferred method** of data collection. If you are working on some OpenStack related project and are using the Oslo library, you are kindly invited to come and talk to one of the project members to learn how you could quickly add instrumentation for your project. 2. :term:`Polling agents`, which is the less preferred method, will poll some API or other tool to collect information at a regular interval. The polling approach is less preferred due to the load it can impose on the API services.5. kafka, which publishes data to a Kafka message queue to be consumed by any system that supports Kafka. 6. file, which publishes samples to a file with specified name and location; 7. database, which stores samples to the legacy ceilometer database system.

commit_message:
Use native v3 tox jobs

Instead of a legacy tox job, use the already defined functional jobs
that do the same. Note that those jobs are named "functional", so update
tox.ini as well.

Remove unused playbooks.

Change-Id: Icdb1b94b0e69ffb55007e166705871010e8943c5
(cherry picked from commit 396ce758e9f1c6ec2e02aa284a722fd624af6b2e)

commit_message:
tests: test-cinder-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I6e6a232a213f0951f3d5fff8b4efac5898ce6d76
(cherry picked from commit 6b739f21e3fade24be51898e672dee9098402574)

added_lines: 1) A working Glance/Keystone installation (for example, devstack)If you are using devstack, a yaml file will have been created for you with the name /etc/openstack/clouds.yaml. The test code knows where to find it, so if you're using devstack, you don't need to do anything else. project_domain_id: default user_domain_id: defaultThe tests will look for a file named 'clouds.yaml' in the following locations (in this order, first found wins): * current directory * ~/.config/openstack * /etc/openstack You may also set the environment variable OS_CLIENT_CONFIG_FILE to the absolute pathname of a file and that location will be inserted at the front of the search list.

commit_message:
Updating default keystone API verson to 3

Updating to use the Keystone API v3 by default. This will result
in the default for Horizon being v3 as well.

Implements blueprint: default-keystone-api-3

Change-Id: I2113fff3307da4045abbdd45ae93650ee918fdd9

commit_message:
Fix region sticky issue

This could be a regression issue since it works before. But now,
after user login, and switch the region, logout and re-login, the
region last time used can't be sticky. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ib922c6b32307d2b07582c9c0b25102e7cb53bbf8
Close-Bug: #1704239

commit_message:
Make the allowed_address_pairs driver better

The allowed address pairs network driver did not handle having objects
already deleted properly and would prematurely fail.
This patch improves the edge case handling of the driver.

Change-Id: Ice15aa2d6309648da43d6a40ce0286d5dce17500
Story: 2001258
Task: 5791

commit_message:
Configure backends from API host

The tasks to configure cinder backends require that the API be
available. Since the API service should be installed after the volume
service, run these tasks against an API host instead of a volume host.

Change-Id: I6f39b4da6d4d8a3768f157c73970fe0177885ff3

commit_message:
Disable unstable tempest test_run_ssh_proxied_action test

This disables test_run_ssh_proxied_action. Currently it causes the tests to
fail frequently which makes them less useful and blocks patches incorrectly.

Related-Bug: #1736685
Change-Id: I9bd4cb8f828eca3e3227d8e52ef916191a36b45f

commit_message:
Fix docs builds

With the new way of generating docs in the gate[1] our autodoc builds
are slightly broken. Put the required dependencies for doc building and
autodoc generation into doc/requirements.txt. We can also now remove
docs-related requirements from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: I77a09349304451041491893466ca98ba6ebdf96b

internal DNS resolution. With this, VMs within the same network can use
the 'dns_name' associated with the other ports. When the VMs send the
DNS request, it is resolved by ovn-controller if the dns is configured
in the 'DNS' table in the OVN Northbound db.

For each network, a DNS row is created and the 'records' column contain
the dns names and the ip addresses to resolve. The dns record is added

and 'dns_domain' in neutron.conf should be defined other than 'openstack.local'.

commit_message:
Add native DNS support

OVN supports native DNS. This patch makes use of this feature for
internal DNS resolution. With this, VMs within the same network can use
the 'dns_name' associated with the other ports. When the VMs send the
DNS request, it is resolved by ovn-controller if the dns is configured
in the 'DNS' table in the OVN Northbound db.

For each network, a DNS row is created and the 'records' column contain
the dns names and the ip addresses to resolve. The dns record is added
only of the 'dns_name', 'dns_assignment' and 'device_id' of the port is
set.

In order to use this feature, "dns" extension driver should be loaded
and 'dns_domain' in neutron.conf should be defined other than 'openstack.local'.

Change-Id: I59bdc0bc2665118fe8025a12a1c1961e04444abc
Closes-bug: #1688172
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/15/522215/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import dns as dns_apideffrom networking_ovn.common import utilsclass TestDNSRecords(base.TestOVNFunctionalBase): _extension_drivers = ['port_security', 'dns'] def _validate_dns_records(self, expected_dns_records): observed_dns_records = [] for dns_row in self.nb_api.tables['DNS'].rows.values(): observed_dns_records.append( {'external_ids': dns_row.external_ids, 'records': dns_row.records}) self.assertItemsEqual(expected_dns_records, observed_dns_records) def _validate_ls_dns_records(self, lswitch_name, expected_dns_records): ls = idlutils.row_by_value(self.nb_api.idl, 'Logical_Switch', 'name', lswitch_name) observed_dns_records = [] for dns_row in ls.dns_records: observed_dns_records.append( {'external_ids': dns_row.external_ids, 'records': dns_row.records}) self.assertItemsEqual(expected_dns_records, observed_dns_records) def setUp(self): ovn_config.cfg.CONF.set_override('dns_domain', 'ovn.test') super(TestDNSRecords, self).setUp() def test_dns_records(self): expected_dns_records = [] nets = [] for n, cidr in [('n1', '10.0.0.0/24'), ('n2', '20.0.0.0/24')]: net_kwargs = {dns_apidef.DNSDOMAIN: 'ovn.test.'} net_kwargs['arg_list'] = (dns_apidef.DNSDOMAIN,) res = self._create_network(self.fmt, n, True, **net_kwargs) net = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) nets.append(net) res = self._create_subnet(self.fmt, net['network']['id'], cidr) self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) # At this point no dns records should be created n1_lswitch_name = utils.ovn_name(nets[0]['network']['id']) n2_lswitch_name = utils.ovn_name(nets[1]['network']['id']) self._validate_dns_records(expected_dns_records) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n1_lswitch_name, expected_dns_records) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n2_lswitch_name, expected_dns_records) port_kwargs = {'arg_list': (dns_apidef.DNSNAME,), dns_apidef.DNSNAME: 'n1p1'} res = self._create_port(self.fmt, nets[0]['network']['id'], device_id='n1p1', **port_kwargs) n1p1 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) port_ips = " ".join([f['ip_address'] for f in n1p1['port']['fixed_ips']]) expected_dns_records = [ {'external_ids': {'ls_name': n1_lswitch_name}, 'records': {'n1p1': port_ips, 'n1p1.ovn.test.': port_ips}} ] self._validate_dns_records(expected_dns_records) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n1_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[0]]) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n2_lswitch_name, []) # Create another port, but don't set dns_name. dns record should not # be updated. res = self._create_port(self.fmt, nets[1]['network']['id'], device_id='n2p1') n2p1 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) self._validate_dns_records(expected_dns_records) # Update port p2 with dns_name. The dns record should be updated. body = {'dns_name': 'n2p1'} data = {'port': body} req = self.new_update_request('ports', data, n2p1['port']['id']) res = req.get_response(self.api) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_int) port_ips = " ".join([f['ip_address'] for f in n2p1['port']['fixed_ips']]) expected_dns_records.append( {'external_ids': {'ls_name': n2_lswitch_name}, 'records': {'n2p1': port_ips, 'n2p1.ovn.test.': port_ips}}) self._validate_dns_records(expected_dns_records) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n1_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[0]]) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n2_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[1]]) # Create n1p2 port_kwargs = {'arg_list': (dns_apidef.DNSNAME,), dns_apidef.DNSNAME: 'n1p2'} res = self._create_port(self.fmt, nets[0]['network']['id'], device_id='n1p1', **port_kwargs) n1p2 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) port_ips = " ".join([f['ip_address'] for f in n1p2['port']['fixed_ips']]) expected_dns_records[0]['records']['n1p2'] = port_ips expected_dns_records[0]['records']['n1p2.ovn.test.'] = port_ips self._validate_dns_records(expected_dns_records) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n1_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[0]]) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n2_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[1]]) # Remove device_id from n1p1 body = {'device_id': ''} data = {'port': body} req = self.new_update_request('ports', data, n1p1['port']['id']) res = req.get_response(self.api) self.assertEqual(200, res.status_int) expected_dns_records[0]['records'].pop('n1p1') expected_dns_records[0]['records'].pop('n1p1.ovn.test.') self._validate_dns_records(expected_dns_records) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n1_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[0]]) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n2_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[1]]) # Delete n2p1 self._delete('ports', n2p1['port']['id']) expected_dns_records[1]['records'] = {} self._validate_dns_records(expected_dns_records) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n1_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[0]]) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n2_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[1]]) # Delete n2 self._delete('networks', nets[1]['network']['id']) del expected_dns_records[1] self._validate_dns_records(expected_dns_records) self._validate_ls_dns_records(n1_lswitch_name, [expected_dns_records[0]]) # Delete n1p1 and n1p2 and n1 self._delete('ports', n1p1['port']['id']) self._delete('ports', n1p2['port']['id']) self._delete('networks', nets[0]['network']['id']) self._validate_dns_records([])

commit_message:
Fix docs builds

With the new way of generating docs in the gate[1] our autodoc builds
are slightly broken. Put the required dependencies for doc building and
autodoc generation into doc/requirements.txt. We can also now remove
docs-related requirements from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Ifbd16fe364bb216821125c70bb7d3ab0ac1f10a3

commit_message:
Drop flavor name validation in horizon side.

This patch drop name validation in horizon and
let nova check if the is name is valid or not.
Instead of using pattern in the flavors form,
pattern will be checked in the nova. Also I
added limation for the name size with tests to
check the max size since the min size has it's unit
test.

Closes-Bug: 1738328
Change-Id: Ib4f6f9b87560df43819d992254603e55ea8ff6a3

commit_message:
Break TestMappingPurge into multiple tests

The previous approach tested all the possible scenarios for passing
arguments to the `mapping_purge` utility in a single test case. This
patch isolates each scenario into it's own dedicated test case for
easier readability.

Change-Id: I698ae00cc412f5f5048c9a983748ac3687a7715a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/38/471138/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Prevent duplicate pull_from_zanata on the same repo

If django and python modules are on the same repo, propose translation
script overwrites on the second run with pull_from_zanata files from
other modules. This is not required because the full project files
will already fetched on the first run.

see
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/master/propose-translation-update/4826efb/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-12-16_06_38_59_479293

Change-Id: I02f8bf74e9bd8f572877368e3e13d950d6639768
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/18/528518/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Pull updated translations from Zanata only the first time if [ ! -f .zanata-pull ] ; then touch .zanata-pull pull_from_zanata "$project" fi
deleted_lines: # Pull updated translations from Zanata pull_from_zanata "$project"

commit_message:
[placement] Separate API schemas (allocation_candidate)

In compute APIs, they have their schemas in the
independent directory (nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas).
Placement APIs should be like that as well.

This patch separates API schemas to an independent directory
(nova/api/openstack/placement/schemas)
from nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/allocation_candidate.py.

Change-Id: I56a99e40a156e54923ea40fc71b18194e3ee8f7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/528635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

"""Placement API schemas for getting allocation candidates.""" # Represents the allowed query string parameters to the GET # /allocation_candidates API call GET_SCHEMA_1_10 = { "type": "object", "properties": { "resources": { "type": "string" }, }, "required": [ "resources", ], "additionalProperties": False, }

subject: Provide support for SFC deployments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-10 15:12:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/b2df131842078edb2f9dfabc15477d04fdc187dc', 'message': '[WIP] Provide support for SFC deployments

This patch allows to deploy SFC capable deployments when deploying OSA with
ODL. It does the following:

- Installs the neutron networking-sfc project
- Adds SFC to the features which ODL activates
- Incorporates SFC options to neutron.conf

Change-Id: I6bf2be1aef1bb612640f5d8cc101136f618fabd8
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-10 15:51:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/57d63aefc8dde8ea49d871f87d740b855caadd66', 'message': 'Provide support for SFC deployments

This patch allows to deploy SFC capable deployments when deploying OSA with
ODL. It does the following:

- Installs the neutron networking-sfc project
- Adds SFC to the features which ODL activates
- Incorporates SFC options to neutron.conf

In order to use it, you need to have ODL running and you should add the next
items to the neutron_plugin_base when executing it:

networking_sfc.services.flowclassifier.plugin.FlowClassifierPlugin
networking_sfc.services.sfc.plugin.SfcPlugin

Change-Id: I6bf2be1aef1bb612640f5d8cc101136f618fabd8
